ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Marriage (Baseline)
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Troubles with the boss
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Detention in jail or other institution
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Death of spouse
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Major change in sleeping habits (a lot more or a lot less sleep, or change in part of day when asleep)
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Death of a close family member
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Major change in eating habits (a lot more or a lot less food intake, or very different eating hours or surroundings)
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Foreclosure on a mortgage or loan
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Revision of personal habits (dress, manners, associations, etc.
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Death of a close friend
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Minor violations of the law (e.g. traffic tickets, jay walking, disturbing the peace, etc.)
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Outstanding personal achievement
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Pregnancy
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Major change in the health or behavior of a family member
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Sexual difficulties
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? In-law troubles
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Major change in number of family get-togethers (e.g. a lot more or a lot less than usual)
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Major change in financial state (e.g. a lot worse off or a lot better off than usual)
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Gaining a new family member (e.g. through birth, adoption, oldster moving in, etc.)
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Change in residence
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Son or daughter leaving home (e.g. marriage, attending college, etc.)
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Marital separation from mate
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Major change in church activities (e.g. a lot more or a lot less than usual)

On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Being fired from work
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Divorce
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Changing to a different line of work

On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Major change in the number of arguments with spouse (e.g. either a lot more or a lot less than usual regarding childrearing, personal habits, etc.)
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Major change in responsibilities at work (e.g. promotion, demotion, lateral transfer)
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Wife beginning or ceasing work outside the home
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Major change in working hours or conditions
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Major change in usual type and/or amount of recreation
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Taking on a mortgage greater than $10,000 (e.g. purchasing a home, business, etc.
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Taking on a mortgage or loan less than $10,000 (e.g. purchasing a car, TV, freezer, etc.)
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Major personal injury or illness
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Major business readjustment (e.g. merger, reorganization, bankruptcy, etc.)
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Major change in social activities (e.g. clubs, dancing, movies, visiting, etc.)
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Major change in living conditions (e.g. building a new home, remodeling, deterioration of home or neighborhood.)
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Retirement from work
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Vacation
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Christmas
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Changing to a new school
On a relative scale, how much of a readjustment would the following situation be? Beginning or ceasing formal schooling
Have you moved during the last 12 months?
Have you broken off an engagement to be married or ended an intimate relationship during the last 12 months?
Did you get married during the last 12 months?
Did someone you were close to die during the last 12 months?
Were you separated or divorced during the last 12 months?
Did you break up with a close friend during the last 12 months?

Have you had any important relationship, for example, with your spouse, a close friend, your boss, or a family member become significantly worse during the last 12 months (this should not include the relationship referred to in item 6 above)?
Did you have a child or adopt a child during the last 12 months?
Have you, a very close friend, or close family member had an accident that required emergency medical treatment during the last 12 months?
Have you, a very close friend, or close family member been hospitalized for a serious (life- threatening) illness during the last 12 months?
Have you or your spouse/partner been pregnant during the last 12 months?
Have you or your spouse/partner had an abortion during the last 12 months?
Have you or your spouse/partner had a miscarriage or stillbirth during the last 12 months?
Have you or your spouse/partner lost or changed jobs or been involuntarily unemployed during the last 12 months?

During the last 12 months, have you or your spouse/partner had any serious problems or disappointment at school or in an educational course (university, training program, etc.)? (answer only for you if both had disappointments)
Have you or your spouse/partner had significant success at work or in an educational course (university, training program) during the last 12 months?

Has your house been broken into and/or burgled during the last 12 months?
